citation.article-title: Mesoflavibacter zeaxanthinifaciens gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel zeaxanthin-producing marine bacterium of the family Flavobacteriaceae.

p.s: Mesoflavibacter (Me.so.fla.vi.bac’ter. Gr. adj. mesos, middle (temperature); L. adj. flavus, yellow; N.L. masc. n. bacter, rod; N.L. masc. n. Mesoflavibacter, a yellow rod-like bacterium with middle temperature growth)
Gram-negative, non-spore-forming rods motile by gliding.
MK-6 is the only respiratory quinone.
Carotenoid pigments are produced, but not flexirubin-type pigments.
As determined by 16S rRNA gene sequence analysis, the genus Mesoflavibacter is a member of the family Flavobacteriaceae.
The G+C content of the type strain of the type species is 32.0 mol%.
The type species of the genus is M. zeaxanthinifaciens.
